title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Music Playlist Manager** that works with a list of songs. **Requirements:** - Create a playlist with at least 5 song names - Display the total number of songs - Show the first song in the playlist - Show the last song in the playlist - Show the middle song (use integer division for the index) - Print all songs with their position numbers (1-based: "1. Song Name") - Ask the user for a position number and display that song (handle invalid input) - Calculate and display the average song title length **Example Output:** 
=== My Playlist ===
Total songs: 5
Now playing: Bohemian Rhapsody
Final song: Sweet Child O' Mine
Middle song: Hotel California

Full Playlist:
1. Bohemian Rhapsody
2. Stairway to Heaven
3. Hotel California
4. Imagine
5. Sweet Child O' Mine

Enter song position (1-5): 3
Playing: Hotel California

Average title length: 16.2 characters

hints.text: For the playlist, use square brackets: playlist = ['Song1', 'Song2', ...]. First song is playlist[0], last is playlist[-1]. For enumerate, use: for position, song in enumerate(playlist, start=1). To convert 1-based position to 0-based index, subtract 1: index = position - 1. Valid index range is 0 to len(playlist)-1. For string length, use len(song).

commonMistakes.correction: Add : at the end of the line
